website_summaries.verdict: The Archos 7 Home Tablet isn't going to amaze you with its specs or features, but its low price and core Android features--Web, e-mail, media playback--make it a workable iPad alternative.
pros: The Archos 7 Home Tablet delivers a large screen, slim design, microSDHC-based memory expansion, and a familiar Android operating system, all for an unbeatable price
cons: Its resistive touch screen is clunky, the processor is sluggish, storage is skimpy, and basic buttons for home screen and volume control are missing
There's no support for Adobe Flash, Bluetooth, GPS, video output, accelerometer, digital compass, and multitouch, and previous Archos tablet accessories are incompatible
App support is hit or miss--mostly miss

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This device does just about everything you could want it to do. True you should probably know a thing or two about software, but that goes for any device you own. A couple tricky little things though that I noticed: one being that when connecting to another network I have to disable the wireless then re-enable it in order to make the connection, the other is an array of little things you should do to make it more functional like going to archos and downloading the new firmware (which is easy to install) then installing flash 10 beta and skyfire so you can watch youtube videos.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Doorstop
customer_reviews.text: This primitive box was poorly constructed of cheap plastic. It operated about as well as a Fisher Price kids pc. Nothing worked. I returned it immediately. I doubt the even make these anymo r.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Kulesh

customer_reviews.title: Returned it same day
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I can't say this is a "bad" product... but I can only rate it one star. That's not one star as in "awful"... it's one star as in very limited application. No gravometric innards (ie, it doesn't rotate the screen as you flip the device), doesn't access Android Market (goodbye tens of thousands of applications), and it's not upgradable to more recent versions of Android. That puts this into "toy" classification in my book. The quality of the device itself is excellent; it just has VERY limited use.
customer_reviews.author: Wayfinder

customer_reviews.title: Second unit purchase of Archos 7 Home Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is an exceptional travel companion with the WI-FI, very easy to access. It works easily with secure system as well with it's own MAC address. It does how ever lack two things that I expect to be supplied in the near future (I Hope) (1) is useability with AudibleBooks and (2) an upgrade to the OS for using flash for viewing. For less than $200.00 with these minor faults is one great buy. J&R Music and Computer World provides fast and excellent service - I highly recommend them as they have the best price on the net. I will always give them a try when making a purchase........Regards
customer_reviews.author: R. LaBonte

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I got this tablet for my husband for his birthday and I don't think he's put it down! This is a great little gadget for the price. He uses is for email, to view videos, and with a downloaded app, is using it as an ereader. I love the size, I love that the screen is more of a matte screen so it doesn't have the glare that the iPad seems to. It's got a fast boot up time also. It's a great tablet for the beginner (like me) but has enough technical stuff to keep my husband happy to!
customer_reviews.author: Busy mom

customer_reviews.title: Takes some work to get it going good
customer_reviews.text: I'm now satisfied with my Archo's 7 Home tablet. After many hours reading helps and hints on the Archo's 7 Home Tablet Forum and installing some of the programs they advise downloading to beef up the weak and clumsy operating system, I got my android tablet just where I want it. Sept 15, 2010 Archo's posted new firmare that makes the touch keypad a little easier to work with, but you still need a stylus to get best results. If you like to try out this very early version of the Android operating system this sure beats buying a phone.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Vickers

customer_reviews.title: Worth what it cost
customer_reviews.text: So far, I really like the Archos 7. It is what I expected. As everyone else comments, if you are expecting the Touch screen to perform like the IPAD, this is NOT the device for you. But, for the price, in my book, you can't beat it. (At least I don't know of anything else on the market yet that does) It plays videos flawlessly. The screen size is just right. I wish it had an accelerometer so that you could rotate the screen, but for what I use it for, this works.
customer_reviews.author: RJGadgets

customer_reviews.title: for the price I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I received this a few weeks ago, actually I received a bad one and then got one that worked well. For my usage, I have never had to worry about battery life- I can do small tasks while I have breakfast or watch tv- like read the news, do my banking, check out my email, craig's list- videos from vimeo come in really good-- the touch screen isn't all that- maybe it's my massive fingers. What I really like about it is that I can switch out micro sd cards with movies and books or music whenever or wherever I like.
customer_reviews.author: cmv71

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't for me
customer_reviews.text: I returned the Archos after a 2 week trial. It didn't do what I understood from the Amazon description it was supposed to do. I did not like Android, it wouldn't play my movie clips, it wouldn't load my contacts...too many things it just wouldn't do. I ended up buying an Ipad although I really did not want to. However it (Ipad) does load my contacts, my email, my pictures...paid a fortune for it though.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Sliman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy a Zune HD or an ipod touch. I wanted something with wifi. Then I saw this for the same price. The internet is almost exactly like a computer. The touch screen is responsive and if I'm not using wifi at all then it will last about 2 days. With the wifi on then about 1 day. Surprisingly it fits in my pant pocket. So far after a week of use, I LOVE it. I don't regret it at all.
customer_reviews.author: D.I.S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little Android tablet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to help get rid of my dependency on my laptop. I have setup my calendar and emails to the tablet and allows for quick searching on the Internet. The tablet has Android 1.6, which for me works. I keep this tablet by me so if I hear a chime for new email or need to add an appointment I can quickly get that done. The battery life is over 10 hours and the device is light and thin. I like this product so much that I am looking to purchase the 10 Archos Internet tablet. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: purpledoc

customer_reviews.title: Nice device for the price
customer_reviews.text: You really can't beat this device for the price. Video looks great, music sounds good. The touch screen works well, being a resistive screen. The only things that could have made this device better is if it came with Android 2.x and a better Market Place. But, all in all a very nice device for general web and multimedia applications.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Vandiver

customer_reviews.title: Choose carefully
customer_reviews.text: I had one these thinking I would be cool with a media player that was wi-fi capable and an old Android OS. It crashed on me often,the battery would get very hot when charging and the whole thing just quit on me. Save your money and get a real tablet like a Toshiba Thrive or Acer Iconia.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne White

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk, Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk from Archos, Came with much hype and completely a junk product. 1. The touch screen never responds. Very hard to open an app. 2. Old version of Android, noway you can upgrade software. 3. Battery life is too low, effectively 30 minutes of video, after that battery dies(this is after 6 months of usage). 4. Suddenly audio stops, need to restart the device. 5. No way to play any of the videos from web. 6. Very slow response. This came with a price tag of $199, which I paid, one can get this for $80 now a days. if you really wanted to waste your money one can buy this..
customer_reviews.author: Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet.
customer_reviews.text: First let me say that I knew what I was getting before I bought this little gem and was intelligent enough not to compare it to the Apple iPad. It runs Google Android version 1.5 and does NOT include the official Android Market. This is the only gripe I have with this tablet and the device is easily rooted to install a different firmware that does include the market. The resistive touchscreen is surprisingly responsive. Apps are plentiful and many are free. Overall I have had a positive experience with the Archos 7 Home Tablet and would purchase one again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: DarkN00b

customer_reviews.title: good for average user
customer_reviews.text: If you are really into technology and would use this everyday, id suggest getting something more up to date with better specs but its a good little item, just was not as quick and responsive as needed
customer_reviews.author: Shali Urquhart

customer_reviews.title: best tablet for the money
customer_reviews.text: Considering the $200 price tag, this machine is loaded with features. This is great for people like me who like their desktop, hate laptops but still want something to use on the go. If the description is not clear you must know; Screen is single touch No camera No video output The app store is better them some reviews let on. This product is great for people who want to use it to consume media and have a cell phone. You can get an app to read books on the droid and i-phone but who wants to read a book on a 3-4 inch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great for reading and movies. Terrible battery life
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't matter if you can surf on the web, see movies with great image quality and read books with the fantastic aldiko widget if the joy of doing those things is so restricted in time due the battery life. Another issue is that the SO is Android 1 and it can't load flash 10. So I reduce it's usage to reading books, seeing movies and surfing on traditional webs. It could be fantastic if the battery could be replaced (or recharged by the USB port) and if Archos release an update of the Android System. But its so cheap...
customer_reviews.author: Bertranao

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it knowing it's flaws and thinking I could live with them. It looked impressive and felt really good. If you've never used and capacitve screen you'd probably be ok with it. I bought it thinking I could open up the market, which I did easily and that it could get the kids off my phone. I ended up sending it back, not because it's bad it's just there is or willl be much better out there and I'm willing to wait.
customer_reviews.author: Tobal

customer_reviews.title: A pretty nice toy
customer_reviews.text: I was going to rate the Archos 7 as a great toy, but the touch tablet is to bad for that. It is hard to get around on the Internet and a lot of the Android applications do not work on the Archos 7. I would not recomend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: good out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The Archos 7 work fine out of the box, internet via wifi was very quick. I was able to connect to youtube, while the selected program pops up i was unable to streem and watch any clip from youtube. It brings up your selection but cannot play it. This is my main problem but apart from this i would recomment it to any one.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Haynes

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: Got my archos 7 about 3 months now and I'm happy. Its not a laptop laptop replacement or a phone but it fills the void in between. Battery life is awsome, screen is high def and bright. Audio is great. Only grips, no youtube support because no flash 10. The keyboard is not the most responsive. All and all good buy nice potable and versitile.
customer_reviews.author: Collin Walters

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: This product was received in a timely manner and in the exact condition that is was advertised. I would recommend this for anyone who is not concerned with the latest and greatest. But wants a functional tablet with basic features.
customer_reviews.author: Jmagic12

customer_reviews.title: Close.. but
customer_reviews.text: The android marketplace from Archos is severely limited, reducing the value of the device. I use it to view lecture video while on the commuter train and it works fine for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: R. M. Farrell

customer_reviews.title: I got screwed
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't give it even one star if I could. Not even my 3-year old wants to play pretend on this refund less POS.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low video playback performance.
customer_reviews.text: I have both 160GB Archos 7 and 8GB Archos 7 Home Tablet. The video playback performance on the old Archos 7 is WAY BETTER than the new Archos 7 HT. The LCD screen is of lower quality and the touchscreen is not as responsive as the old Archos 7. I'm returning the Archos 7 HT.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S

customer_reviews.title: Poor support, limited usefullness
customer_reviews.text: Due to the company not supporting upgrades to newer versions of the Android OS, this product is rendered pretty useless as an e-book reader and for many other Android applications. It has great potential, but in the future I will be avoiding Archos products because of my experience with this product.
customer_reviews.author: P. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this item only to find out its performance was very poor. I found myself almost pounding on the screen to get it to respond. After a couple of days of frustration, I returned the tablet. My advice is don't bother with this and get something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Janet F. Goodpaster-gates

customer_reviews.title: Archos 7
customer_reviews.text: Its better than most ipad clones....however...android market is missing...the appslib....is miniscule. Other than that it does it all well. I pleasantly surprised with a better model than i ordered.
customer_reviews.author: ken

customer_reviews.title: Just what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews here and did quite a bit of research before buying, and this product is exactly what I expected. No, it's not an iPad comparable product. It does however do everything I wanted it to do. I can browse the web, manage my email, listen to music and watch a movie if I so desire. I highly suggest installing the firmware update and skyfire. If you're looking for a tablet that's easy on the wallet, and performs basic functions, you'll be happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Holtinator

customer_reviews.title: It's ok - I'm sure there are better out there
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it does what it says it does. Not thrilled with apps by archos and decent apps are not easy to find and download. Reader is not easy on the eyes. I like the size.. browser is easy, wifi connect is quick,
customer_reviews.author: scubagirrl

customer_reviews.title: Nice features - but freezes up
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit with the intention of using droid apps and web browsing. It was pretty easy to use and worked fine for browsing. After loading some apps it quickly becomes sluggish and then freezes up either while loading apps or browsing. I simply reset it with the reset button after the first time and second time, but on the third freeze (2 days into use) I just packed it up and sent it back. Too bad because I liked the features, weight, size, and convenience.
customer_reviews.author: therileyfam

customer_reviews.title: Good product, just shy of great...
customer_reviews.text: The Archos 7 home tablet is good for checking your email while your setting on the couch watching TV. It won't replace a laptop, but it wasn't designed to. After using it for a couple of weeks, I realize some of its limitations and short comings. Overall, for the money, The Archos 7 does what it is suppose to very well.
customer_reviews.author: High_Tech_ Redneck

customer_reviews.title: Not ready,and rushed to market
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received had a cracked screen. The second one was ok but when you press on the back slightly (near right side) the lcd would flutter. This tablet was clearly rushed to market hoping to make a quick profit before the avalanche of tablets of higher quality hit the market. Pretty soon the tablets will replace laptops and we'll have more of choices from better quality vendors. I will not buy the ipad because it doesnt have a user replaceable battery like this one. Wait for the other tablets to come out and then wait for them to go down in price. The touch screen on this thing will drive you mad!!!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Archos 7 8GB Home Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I have just bought it as a gift. So far I hve not heard of any problem on it. However, I need more time for proper evaluation to monitor its use by the recipient.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: garbage..
customer_reviews.text: this is a real waste of money. dont buy it. it freezes all the time, u better give ur money to help people instead wasting on this.
customer_reviews.author: oscar chacon

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I was very sorry I purchased this tablet. It had no features. I sent the first one back because it was defective. It needed to be reset every couple of minutes. The secind one I found didn't do anything. If you want features then buy the Archos 5. The 7 is a piece of junk. You can't do anything with it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Charmak

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: This is not what it appears to be. You cannot download hardly any apps for it at all and definatley none of the "fun" ones...Android is a great system but this apparently has the cheapest version of it. I bought it as a gift for my Husband and luckily I took it out of the box to try it out first...I returned it immediately!!! Save your money and time!
customer_reviews.author: Miley17

customer_reviews.title: Archos
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted me to get this instead of a netbook. The touch screen is very poor. It is very slow to get on the internet and difficult to use. The home and menu buttons are in the edges of a poor touchscreen. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Deanomoto

customer_reviews.title: Very cool, bad screen
customer_reviews.text: Does a really good job being truly high definition, the screen isn't very sensitive to touch. If your looking to substitute to an ipad, get an ipad. I have both and love the archos for what it can do, but it doesn't compare to the ipad at all. It's also kind of awkward to carry, but so is the ipad so that doesn't say much.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: it is what it is
customer_reviews.text: It is an okay tablet, i dont know if it can be updated or not but this would be a plua, got this my my grandson and he likes it okay, not real good apps on it though
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: archos 7
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our 8 year old daughter, I thought you could download alot of apps, i could only get about 20 on there. The screen is so so touchy which makes it hard to do anything, also i had problems with it shutting down, or saying unable to load with perfect signal with wi-fi! WOULD NOT RECOMMEND FOR ANYONE!!!!
customer_reviews.author: hunter66

customer_reviews.title: OK unit but touch screen is frustrating to use
customer_reviews.text: bought the unit because of what you got for the price; however, got frustrated w/ the poor performance of the touch screen, and had to reset the unit a few times in order to start it, battery life was not as expected. It is, however, a great browser and video player, and a great e-book reader. Ended up returning it though because of the unresponsive touch screen and having to reset the unit too many times. It may have been defective.
customer_reviews.author: engineer user

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: bought this a couple months back..waste of money and time. believe me you are better off waiting for a new ipad. the screen sensitivity is mediocre at least. my Iphone has more use then this thing. it is now in the closet catching dust. thanks archos for a faulty product that does.....nothing well.
customer_reviews.author: eazy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We were disappointed with the Archos 7. Perhaps it is a generational thing as we are in our sixties. But the screen was not particularly sensitive, the battery seemed to deplete faster than one might expect and, most importantly, we kept losing wireless connection cutting us off from the internet. We returned the Archos 7 to the vendor, along with the accompanying scan disc (never used) that we had purchased, but have received a refund only for the Archos. We went out and bought an Acer netbook for about $100 more and it has met all our expectations. Not once has it lost wireless connection with the same router we had used with the Archos 7.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Costello

customer_reviews.title: Archos 7 Home Tablet
customer_reviews.text: All I really wanted was a MP3 player. What the tablet had in store for me was awesome! I love it! It's wonderful for videos. I use it on the go, at home, everywhere! It's really, really good. Better than iPod. Only con is no accelerometer.
customer_reviews.author: poper117

customer_reviews.title: my home tablet
customer_reviews.text: thank you for the speedy delivery i like my tablet but since we are not doing to great this year for christmas i will be giving it to my son thanks once again
customer_reviews.author: rayski

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your child's money!
customer_reviews.text: Thinking about buying an archos tablet? Think again. They are junk. They are difficult to use, have NO support and stop working right when they are out of warranty. Do not buy this product! My child spent months saving for this unit and it worked intermittantly for two months and then stopped working all together. Archos will not replace it. Very poor product!!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Definately Better out there...
customer_reviews.text: When I found this tablet, for the price i found it ...i was shocked and happy. Then it came in the mail., and boy was I shocked and not so happy. Its small, apps are little and far between - cant play youtube - can access anything really. and because it has Android so doesnt mean you can download from the Android Market - that in itself is mainly the point to getting a tablets - So i sent this thingamabob back and opted to spend the extra layers of cash and get me one of those darn Ipads - which is hard for me to do seeing i think they have enough of the worlds money. peace out...
customer_reviews.author: syv

customer_reviews.title: don't buy Archos 7 Home Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Pros screen size battery life sound quality video player Cons touch screen is hard. Older Android version. Very difficult to found good Apps Music player. far of iTunes. far of iPod. not user friendly Not good PDF reader Not office docs reader Not office docs writer Not charge from computer Frecuently crashes and it's necesary to shut down Why Archos releases a poor tested product?. cheap isn't synonimous of bad.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: May as well wait for Android tablets that have something newer than Cupcake on 'em. Terrible touchscreen, limited and lame apps. Navigation is pure garbage.
customer_reviews.author: AndyVee

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: Wow. What can I say. Specially price under200 This is great device. Touch screen is very accurate and smooth Screen is clear and perfect,long Battery life, process speed everything is great I highly recommand to anyone. Go get it now click Archos 7 is the best device they ever made
customer_reviews.author: JAE lee

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: this product fulfill my expectations, this product is functional, sincerely like so much, and is just that i need to my job!
customer_reviews.author: Marco Castro

customer_reviews.title: Big Mistake!!!
customer_reviews.text: This will NOT run most Android apps!!!!!!!! It is not recognized by Google as far as meeting their criteria for approved devices. Apps for this are only available via Archos's app library (which is very very limited unless you want hot girls wallpaper), not the official Google Library. Does NOT do FLASH Does not do NETFLIX It is slow, you need to take steroids to use the touch screen, and apps freeze a lot. Yeah yeah I know its under $200.00, and if all you want to do is check email, surf non flash sites, and maybe watch a movie, I guess it's sorta OK.
customer_reviews.author: LASH

customer_reviews.title: ok tablet
customer_reviews.text: the archos is not a good system very slow get a eken 100 dollars it is way faster mabe better cause of upgrades
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable flaws
customer_reviews.text: Thts was a gift for my grandson, who is a Web Designer by trade, he was disappointed in the short battery life, the slow response time and a not very sensitive touch screen. So I had him return it and he purchased an Archo-5. Let's hope this one works out better.
customer_reviews.author: Angel F.

customer_reviews.title: looks better than it works
customer_reviews.text: I liked the look of it, but found it to be very slow and unresponsive, touch screen was very tough and after a week or so the product just died, I don't know why, your better off spending more money and getting an Ipad or waiting for another tablet to come out.
customer_reviews.author: johnMilton

customer_reviews.title: LOL's
customer_reviews.text: This is not a bad tablet for the price, but not for anything serious. Lousy touchscreen, very erratic and unresponsive, tap, tap, tap, tap, taptaptaptap..... :-( You get what you paid for. Nice sound, nice picture, but taptaptaptap to get it to work. At first I couldn't get pass the touch screen calibration. It would not go to 'next', so I had to go back. I use the included program to format a microSD card and afterwards, it would not recognize it. Da? A nice toy for a young kid, but get serious, not for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Burke WWII Vet

customer_reviews.title: Bad Purchase
customer_reviews.text: The product looks cool, but that is as far as it goes. It is very slow, network has problems continually disconnects. After running it for a bit shut down and would not reboot. Sent it back after one day, it needs work.
customer_reviews.author: JJbean

customer_reviews.title: Sadly Quit Working
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this unit quit working right after receipt. Returned free ups pick up Highly satisfied with Amazon service.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I could live with hacking this device if the touchscreen was half-way decent. It was so frustrating to use I just packed this unit up and sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Ed B

customer_reviews.title: cheap player,It performs as the price, don't expect more
customer_reviews.text: Hi: I bought this little tablet thinking of use it for e-mail check ebay, amazon surf some gogle and play some videos . it freezes some time touch is bad ,and it performs as the price, please don't expect more than that, even loading pages is quiet slow ,so i suggest you think if you could buy an apple ipad or conformed yourself with that perform, because is slow so you decided.
customer_reviews.author: losveguz

customer_reviews.title: kids review
customer_reviews.text: i love this product.it is so useful.i can browse the net and listen to music.it is great
customer_reviews.author: devin

customer_reviews.title: Completely Useless - Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This device is totally and completely useless. I have never written a review in my life before, but I had to for this to warn people not to buy this. It basically doesn't do anything. You can't use the android ap store, so pretty much all the useful functionality of your droid phone you can't use. The touch screen is awkward and slow, so it's not useful for web browsing. None of the aps that it comes with are useful. You can't watch videos, you can't listen to music, you can't browse the web, you can't play games. I use it as an alarm clock. I ignorantly thought it would be a tablet version of my android phone. Wrong. Terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: not work
customer_reviews.text: i bougth this item but its dont work i charge and never start up im really sad but this purchase
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

product_meta.title: Archos 7 8GB Home Tablet with Android (Black)
product_meta.description:
ARCHOS now introduces a new large-screen Android-based tablet, the ARCHOS 7 home tablet. This new product is specially designed to enhance the digital lifestyle in the home. The ARCHOS 7 home tablet bridges the gap between the smartphone and the desktop PC to provide constant access to the web, customization through Android Apps, and multimedia content - all in a large-screen format. This new device testifies to ARCHOS' strategy of offering innovative electronic products with extremely competitive pricing.

AMAZON.COM
ARCHOS' new ARCHOS 7 Home Tablet bridges the gap between the smartphone and the desktop PC, providing constant access to the web, customization through Android Apps, and delivery of multimedia content--all in a seven-inch widescreen format. Access the information you need, such as news, weather, or local business info. Enjoy your favorite movie clips or watch some YouTube videos for a quick entertainment fix. Or just kick back and listen to some music. With built-in Wi-Fi, quick and easy file transfer, and up to 7 hours video/44 hours music on a single charge, this affordable tablet will keep you entertained--and connected--all day long.

Bridging the gap between the smartphone and the desktop PC. Click to enlarge. 

Enjoy your favorite flicks on a brilliant seven-inch widescreen. 

Share your photos with family and friends. 

With an ultra-portable design, it's not just a home tablet. 

MULTIMEDIA MASTER
With its wide, high-resolution screen (800 x 480), the ARCHOS 7 home tablet is the perfect device for enjoying and sharing your multimedia content. 8 gigabytes of on-board flash memory gives you room for up to 7 full-length movies, 80,000 photos, or 4,000 songs, and the micro SDHC slot lets you swap in memory cards with even more content. The Lithium Polymer battery provides up to 7 hours of video or 42 hours of audio on a single charge. Videos, Photos and Music
Whether you want to watch videos, share photos, or listen to your favorite music, the device supports an impressive number of file formats. 

You have the ability to watch videos in the most popular formats, even in HD (720p). H.264, MPEG-4, and Realvideo codecs are supported, with AVI, MP4, MKV, MOV, and FLV file formats. You can also share your favorite videos with your friends on your TV screen using the composite video output (cable sold separately). 

Upload your pictures directly to the device through the USB connection or the micro SDHC slot. You can view and share all of your pictures on the brilliant 7-inch screen or play them to your television, as with movies. Combine your favorite photos with your favorite songs and play a slideshow for your friends and family. JPEG, BMP, and GIF images supported. 

The ARCHOS 7 home tablet also allows you to store your favorite songs and create your playlists, with up to 40 hours of music. And unlike a lot of the players out there, it lets you enjoy all kinds of different formats, with support for MP3, WMA (non-protected), WAV, APE, OGG, FLAC, and AAC files. 

Android Applications
Enjoy a selection of pre-installed applications ready for use straight out of the box. Also, since the ARCHOS 7 is an Android-based system, you can customize your home tablet by downloading your favorite applications. Choose from thousands available in the Android Market. You can also access a large variety of free and purchasable applications directly from the AppsLib store. These apps are sorted by genre, ratings and date to help you find the one you want. 

CONSTANT COMPANION
The ARCHOS 7 Home Tablet is the epitome of the everyday device, with features to suit your whole family's daily needs. Fast & Easy Access to the Latest News
Use the web browser or the many applications available on the AppsLib store to keep you informed of the latest news. Access your favorite newspapers, sports or financial information directly from the home tablet. 

Save Time by Consulting Instant Information Services
The ARCHOS 7 Home Tablet offers easy access to information services, such as weather and local business directories. You can also configure different services to appear as live widgets on the home screen, for an always-on view of the information that matters most. 

Who Needs a PC?
Use the USB host connection to connect a mouse, keyboard, or external mass storage device so you can surf the web or access your office documents easily and quickly. With the home tablet you won't even need to fire up the home PC. 

And with its slim form factor--just 12 mm thick and weighing in at 350 g (0.8 Ibs)--the ARCHOS 7 home tablet is extremely portable. 

STAY CONNECTED
The ARCHOS 7 Home Tablet keeps you up to date on all your web destinations, emails, and social networking sites. Fast & Convenient Web Surfing
With an 800 pixel wide resolution and a seven-inch screen, you can comfortably surf the web. No need to zoom in and out, since the web pages are fully displayed on the ARCHOS screen. In addition, the Wifi connection (802.11 b/g) gives you the ability to enjoy the Internet in every room of your home (or head down to the coffee shop). 

Social Networking & Chat Applications
Thanks to the social networking and chat applications, this new tablet lets you stay in touch with your family and friends all day long. With its comfortable virtual keyboard, it's a breeze to write messages on the ARCHOS 7 home tablet. 

Email Application
Once connected to a Wifi network, the ARCHOS 7 home tablet lets you manage your emails whenever you want. You can configure a variety of email accounts, giving each member of the family quick and easy access to their own messages. 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
ARCHOS 7 home tablet, standard USB cable (micro B/A), power adapter, user guide, legal and safety notice.
